item.title: [LUCENE-2708] when a test Assume fails, display information
item.description:

I think we should output something, at least if you have VERBOSE set, maybe always.

comments.comment:
here's a patch that always dumps the entire stack.

alternatively, maybe we only dump the entire stack on VERBOSE=true, but otherwise use something more brief such as:

     [junit] ------------- Standard Error ---------------
     [junit] NOTE: testStreamURL Assume failed (ignored):
     [junit]     got: <java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://www.apdfgdfgache.org/dist/lucene/solr/>, expected: null
     [junit] ------------- ---------------- ---------------

(printing e.getMessage() instead of dumping stack)

I committed this to revision 1023009, 1023016 (3x)

we can reopen to customize how it looks, but really these assumes are rare (jvm bug, network connection, etc)
I have a better impl with nice messages.

This is great, now we can add messages to all these assumes... this is a real limitation in the junit API.

I'll update the patch with messages added to all assumes
